placeDesc: A collection of medical artifacts, medical photograph, a medical library dating back to 1843, and a recreated doctor’s office from the 1920s, complete with vintage medicines, roll-top desk, microscope and medical bag.A lecture held in the museum entitled, “Quackery, or Not?” displayed a curious cure-all from the same era, a metal cylinder known as the Oxygenator. Though it cured nothing, it was true to its name: it had nothing inside it but air.
placeShortDesc: A small medical museum with a recreated doctor's office.
placeNearby: Spadra Cemetery,Egyptian Building,Chino Planes of Fame Air Museum
placeRelatedPlaces: Under the Black Eagle Pharmacy Museum,University of Florence Museum of Pathological Anatomy,Berliner Medizinhistorisches Museum,Gothenburg Medical History Museum
